I'm really sick of this; what did I do wrong?

public void savefile() throws IOException {
    FileWriter write = new FileWriter("asd.txt", true);
    PrintWriter print = new PrintWriter(write);
    print.write("Knock Knock");
    print.flush();
    print.write("Hello ?");
    print.flush();
    print.write("Hi?");
    print.flush();
    print.write("anybody there?");
    print.flush();
    print.close();
}

<<<explanation>>>: 
In your code, you are using the PrintWriter.write method to write text to a file. However, you are not using it correctly. The write method of PrintWriter does not automatically add a new line character at the end of the text. So, you need to manually add a new line character if you want each text to be on a new line in the file.

Additionally, you don't need to use JOptionPane.showMessageDialog to display messages. You can simply use System.out.println to print messages to the console.

Here is the corrected code:

public void savefile() throws IOException {
    FileWriter write = new FileWriter("asd.txt", true);
    PrintWriter print = new PrintWriter(write);
    print.println("Knock Knock");
    print.flush();
    print.println("Hello ?");
    print.flush();
    print.println("Hi?");
    print.flush();
    print.println("anybody there?");
    print.flush();
    print.close();
}

Now, when you call the savefile method, it will write the text to the file "asd.txt" and each text will be on a new line.
